video.title: Anthony Bourdain: No Reservations Collection
video.synopsis: Grumpy, sharp-tongued host Anthony Bourdain uncovers the best -- and strangest -- in culinary cuisine around the world.

episodes.synopsis: Anthony and his crew traveled to Lebanon to discover a beautiful country, then suddenly find themselves in the middle of an intense conflict.
episodes.title: Beirut

episodes.synopsis: Anthony is in Vancouver, British Columbia, home to a thriving film industry, gorgeous scenery, and an evolving food scene.
episodes.title: Vancouver

episodes.synopsis: Anthony Bourdain travels to Laos, a land of picturesque scenery, exotic cuisines, and a mysterious history.
episodes.title: Laos

episodes.synopsis: Anthony Bourdain is off to Tokyo to explore the relationship between a perfect piece of sushi and a perfect knife blade.
episodes.title: Tokyo

episodes.synopsis: After learning of their roots, Anthony Bourdain and his brother, Chris, are on a mission to connect with their family in Uruguay.
episodes.title: Uruguay

episodes.synopsis: According to Anthony, Spain is the single greatest place for culinary achievement in the world (outside of Asia), thanks in part to Albert Adria.
episodes.title: Spain

episodes.synopsis: In an effort to avoid the lines of tour buses snaking their way to the Sphinx in Egypt, Anthony visits with some of the locals.
episodes.title: Egypt

episodes.synopsis: Anthony is off on a great American road trip to explore the quirky, dark, classic Americana that is the country's Southwestern region.
episodes.title: U.S. Southwest

episodes.synopsis: Tony hits up Chicago and visits Fat Johnnie's Famous Red Hots, Calumet Fisheries, Laurent Gras's L20 Restaurant, and other culinary hot spots.
episodes.title: Chicago

episodes.synopsis: Tony steps away from the Venice of tourists and into the Venice of the locals, visiting the famous Rialto Fish Market and more.
episodes.title: Venice

episodes.synopsis: Having worked in kitchens alongside many Azorean Portuguese immigrants, Tony decides it's time to find out more about their motherland.
episodes.title: Azores

episodes.synopsis: Tony decides to relocate to write the great Vietnamese novel, but first he'll meet a local chef-realtor who'll help him find the perfect property.
episodes.title: Vietnam: There's No Place Like Home

episodes.synopsis: Thai cuisine blends five fundamental flavors: sweet, spicy, sour, bitter, and salty. Anthony sets out to experience each of these tastes.
episodes.title: Thailand

episodes.synopsis: Anthony Bourdain visits the craggy mountainous landscape of Sardinia, his wife's homeland, and learns what it means to be Sardinian.
episodes.title: Sardinia

episodes.synopsis: Anthony Bourdain explores the snow-capped mountains, majestic big skies, winding rivers, and roaming cattle of Livingston, Montana.
episodes.title: Montana

episodes.synopsis: Anthony Bourdain heads to Brittany to experience not only the cuisine, but also its ancient cultures and traditions.
episodes.title: Brittany

episodes.synopsis: Only 60 or so miles up the Hudson River from Manhattan, the Hudson Valley is a luscious land rich with history.
episodes.title: Hudson Valley, NY

episodes.synopsis: Tony's cameraman exposes Tony to the food and people of the "two Maines": the civilized coastal area and the untamed interior region.
episodes.title: Maine

episodes.synopsis: Tony heads back to Africa to visit Liberia, the first independent nation in Africa settled by newly freed American slaves in 1847.
episodes.title: Liberia

episodes.synopsis: Tony visits the state of Kerala, a state mostly devoid of the extreme poverty seen elsewhere in India and virtually untouched by Western franchises.
episodes.title: Kerala, India

episodes.synopsis: We are treated to a glimpse of Rome through Tony's eyes as he dines on mouth-watering classic Italian dishes.
episodes.title: Rome

episodes.synopsis: Tony visits the Ozark Mountains for local delicacies -- from venison to squirrel pot pie. But the trip goes awry when he goes fishing.
episodes.title: Ozarks

episodes.synopsis: In Cuba, Tony attends a baseball game packed with fans and meets Robert Salas, who shares some remarkable photographs of Castro and the revolution.
episodes.title: Cuba

episodes.synopsis: Tony joins chef Ferran Adria in the kitchen and the dining room of Spain's El Bulli, considered by many to be the world's best restaurant.
episodes.title: El Bulli

episodes.synopsis: Tony dines with Croatian locals, swims with tuna, hunts for rare white truffles and is knocked off his feet by an excellent local wine.
episodes.title: Croatian Coast
